intro: Adenocalymma macrostachyum, commonly known as the large-stemmed adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
